revised_title: Dame Janet Maria Vaughan: A Pioneering Life in Science and Education
tldr: Dame Janet Maria Vaughan was a trailblazing scientist and educator who made significant contributions to the fields of haematology and medical research. She overcame numerous obstacles to become a respected clinical pathologist and researcher in the 1930s and 1940s, and later directed a unit investigating the metabolism of radioactive fission products in the 1950s and 1960s. Throughout her life, she was also deeply committed to social justice and education, serving as the Principal of Somerville College from 1945 to 1967.
